comments.body:
Happy to move into another location, just adding this here to get started with this commit.

https://github.com/nikhita/systemstat
this was surprising... is it spurious?
didn't expect these changes...
I'm sure I'm probably missing something here but doesn't the commit https://github.com/json-iterator/go/commit/ab8a2e0c74be9d3be70b3184d9acc634935ded82 contain code changes?
It changes things in the `github.com/json-iterator/go/extra` package, but that's not imported by the main `github.com/json-iterator/go` package, so we don't vendor it.
Also @ixdy do you know why the extra `d` is getting appended here? I have a vendor change that is doing the same thing and I don't know why.
I have no idea how `godep` decides how to truncate the git commit. it might be a git setting, it might be something else. `godep` is terrible.

I think it's just using `git describe --tags`. 

The manpage for `git describe` notes
> Note that the suffix you get if you type these commands today may be longer than what Linus saw  above when he ran these commands, as your Git repository may have new commits whose object names begin with 975b that did not exist back then, and "-g975b" suffix alone may not be sufficient to disambiguate these commits.

so I guess this is WAI? :man_shrugging:
I remember discussing about this with @cblecker somewhere but can't find the issue now... :woman_shrugging:

it has to do with the git version you're running locally. at a certain point, the default changed for `git describe`

see https://github.com/tools/godep/pull/560 for more details. This PR to fix it was opened, but that happened after godep stopped active development.

Similar issue raised in another PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/65632#discussion_r227509437

What is the course of action here? Just ignore these changes? Manually revert them?
+1 to not include the changes that update the comment with just one more character or one less character for the SHA
We could also just scrub all comments from the file. That's what we do with the staging-godeps script
We probably should.  This is getting stupid.
+1 to scrub all comments from the file
submit a PR to address this: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/70687

I don't think this line is supposed to have changed,
same thing was happening on my PR https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/63893#discussion_r189993079
Although, the revision hash is the same so I think this change doesn't break anything
Well, that's even different. This one is really just the same hash, for some reason godep though it would need more digit to avoid collision. That happens frmo time to time ...
What effective docker version are we bumping to?  Has sig-node weighed in on this update yet?
its 1.38.0 and see the comment below :) thanks @Random-Liu
Interesting that it's adding these back in.
ðŸ¤·â€â™‚ï¸  who even understands godep?
:left-shark:
Why are we bumping all of these too? Are those really transitive dependencies of etcd client?

I just followed the guide [Using godep to manage dependencies](https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/godep.md) and it updated godeps for me. I'm not sure why this was updated. But maybe it's a mistake: `g27d450a0` vs `g27d450a`. I will revert it manually.
Took another look and found that this is just a Comment change. I guess it's a upstream Comment change. Here it doesn't bump the real code.
See also: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/57811#discussion_r159820267

we can seee the Godeps.json file in openshift. Its Comment is also `docs-v1.12.0-rc4-2016-07-15-7401-g4f3616f`.
https://github.com/openshift/origin/blob/master/Godeps/Godeps.json#L1219
```
		{
			"ImportPath": "github.com/docker/docker/api",
			"Comment": "docs-v1.12.0-rc4-2016-07-15-7401-g4f3616f",
			"Rev": "4f3616fb1c112e206b88cb7a9922bf49067a7756"
		},
```
why those pkgs are changed from g786cc84 to g786cc841?
not sure.  the revision is still the same, so it shouldn't matter.
Not sure why go deps is changing the suffix on these, but it's only the `Comment` so, not a big deal I suppose.
What version is this? Is there no official release tag that we can use?
I agree that this is something that should be addressed however I don't believe this is the scope of this PR as neither this or the previous one changed the commit number.

There is an actual release - https://github.com/gogo/protobuf/releases/tag/v0.4
I hope a similar release would be available for other dependencies. 
I'd like to avoid vendoring in HEAD of dependencies.
@wojtek-t @shyamjvs since you are experts in this area, can you weigh in?

I'm no expert here, but I'm seeing quite some packages in the file that don't seem to be from standard releases (e.g docker/engine-api, coreos/pkg). Apparently even the go-restful pkg.
IMO allowing only releases could become a serious limitation wrt feature velocity (i.e. wait for an upstream release before using it in your feature).

cc @thockin - the godep god :)
how come the version seems to have moved backwards
resolved
I am wondering if importing `cni/pkg/types` already included the following two.
Nope. Godeps is special :-)

Adding k8s.io/metrics as a vendored package was not a good idea, leading to circular repo dependencies: it depends on k8s.io/apimachinery which is in staging/ here. Changes in apimachinery easily trigger compile errors in vendor/k8s.io/metrics. It's more than tedious to fix them by updating k8s.io/metrics first with a new apimachinery and then re-vendor it here.
@DirectXMan12 I have to generate deepcopies in k8s.io/metrics, but do not see any scripts for that.
Should be in vendor/k8s.io/repo-infra/generate/

> Adding k8s.io/metrics as a vendored package was not a good idea, leading to circular repo dependencies: it depends on k8s.io/apimachinery which is in staging/ her

Well, it was desired not to have the type definitions be part of the main repository, but we need to consume apimachinery, etc as part of the API machinery for registering the API types, having autogenerated clients, etc, so I'm not sure what the solution is there (unless we want to make k8s.io/metrics a staging repo...).

I'm hitting another circular dependency. kubernetes->metric->client-go (which is in kubernetes/staging).

I'm going to generate the metrics client to untangle part of the dependency.

There are other circular dependencies caused by vendoring k8s.io/metrics. IMO we should push to remove the staging folder and develop in the real repos to break the cycle.

cc @thockin another problem caused by staging.
Sent #45159. Still WIP.

I think I'd probably be in favor of moving k8s.io/metrics to staging.  In the short term, it'll also make regenerating the types easier (although I'll need to port a couple of my generator changes, which add pretty simple new tags).

What do you mean by "regenerating the types"? May i ask why it is difficult to regenerate if we move it to thirdparty?

Staging uses the simlink trick to appear as vendored. I prefer not using staging if a plain directory like thirdparty/ works.

BTW, do you know if the clientset is generated in k8s.io/metrics? I tried to run client-gen and the output is quite different.

"regenerating the types" == generating clientset, conversions, protobuf, etc.

`k8s.io/metrics/pkg/apis/custom_metrics` uses a hendwritten client, `k8s.io/metrics/pkg/apis/metrics` uses an autogenerated client.  Both use autogenerated conversions, etc.  The copy of clientgen used to generate clients for `pkg/apis/metrics` was extracted from the main repo a while ago, and then has a couple of improvements tacked on to handle read-only APIs and such.  Unfortunately, it currently only exists in the form of https://github.com/kubernetes/repo-infra/pull/7, because I haven't had a chance to fix up the rest of the stuff in that PR.

I figured if we moved to staging, I could just port the two tweaks to client-gen over to the main repo's client-gen, and then just use the main repo's code gen scripts to generate conversions, etc (and then sync stuff back to the main k8s.io/metrics repo as per the staging sync process).

In the long run, we'll probably need to make out-of-main-repo codegen easier, but that work will probably come as part of the new https://github.com/kubernetes-incubator/apiserver-builder.

> and then sync stuff back to the main k8s.io/metrics repo as per the staging sync process

this part is not easy. I'll need to reconfigure the publishing robot and i don't know if it will work as expected :)
do you need entire `goscaleio` repo or just `types/v1`?
@rootfs The code needs the base package not just `types/v1`
Why this one has changed?
got me?  I did a restore prior to update, didn't touch that.
sha is also the same.
Please use v2 (this can be done in a follow up PR)

That's gonna be a pain, as even v2beta1 from HEAD doesn't work

But ACK, will do

The problem is: you cannot have different version of google apis in vendor. And there are several of them, except for logging
I know. Bumping deps is no easy that why I suggested to do it in a follow up PR;)
why are we importing new curves and internal packages?
We aren't Godeps pulls in all dependencies and these are new ones for the latest crypto.

Was this change intentional? If not please revert.

cc @wojtek-t
no it was not. sent the PR to revert it.
Why update godep version?
It looks like we're not pinning versions anymore, so I figured I should use the latest.
Ahh. Thats right - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/hack/verify-godeps.sh#L80
cc @yifan-gu
#25656 makes that change as well, so this'll cause a merge conflict and, assuming that one gets merged, this change will just be rebased out. If this one goes in first, that can be fine too I think.
Was this intentional?
busted! now you know what version of go I'm using. It's pointless/harmless/not used by anything at all. I could put it back to 1.5, but it really doesn't mean anything at all.
nit: I wish `"github.com/coreos/etcd/client"` was self-sufficient without needing a lot of other packages.
weird extra apostrophes?
+1, what's up with that?
couldn't say, it showed up in my, brendan's and huamin's update. I'm clueless why, but it works.

Split this into it's own commit (with the deps)
